summary: This document is an email chain from June 23, 2020, between an NYPD detective on the FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and an FBI administrative specialist. The detective is requesting subscriber information for a phone number and assistance with VPN/IP masking analysis, and attaches a completed rider for a CTD team.

persons.name: Detective NYPD
persons.role: NYPD Detective on FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The detective is investigating a case, requesting subscriber information for a phone number and asking about VPN expertise, suspecting someone may be masking their IP.

persons.name: Administrative Specialist FBI
persons.role: Administrative Specialist, FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: The specialist is corresponding with the detective, providing support for CAST/DIVRT and sharing contact information for assistance requests.

connections.description: They are communicating about an investigation, with the detective requesting information and assistance from the FBI specialist.

events.title: Email exchange regarding investigation
events.description: An NYPD detective emails an FBI administrative specialist requesting subscriber information for a phone number and asking about VPN expertise, noting a possible IP mask.

keyFacts: An NYPD detective on the FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force is investigating a case involving potential IP masking via VPN.
The detective is seeking subscriber information for a phone number associated with AT&T wireless.
A completed rider for a CTD team is attached to the email.
The correspondence highlights inter-agency collaboration between NYPD and FBI on child exploitation and human trafficking cases.
The FBI administrative specialist supports CAST/DIVRT and the Criminal Branch in the New York Field Office.
